author: cenkner
title: paoDAO School of Blockchain
description: Few solid use cases exist for DAOs and DIDs; education focuses on evaluation and less on learning; blockchain-related curriculum is hard to find and update; few are motivated to participate in upkeep.

f6_assessments.q0: The project presents a crucial added value to the ecosystem which is that of education. This project is a continuation of a previously funded project in F8. It does align with the challenge's directions since it covers DAO education plus some plans to integrate such structure in their educational project. Furthermore, such an educational project can have a global impact since English is widely used worldwide and the program is not location restricted. Hence, it will be a great help to embark new individuals on the Cardano experience.
f6_assessments.q1: Knowing the details from the last funded part of this project and after reviewing the provided materials it is safe to say that the success likelihood of this project is pretty high. For instance, the team already showcased ability from the content already provided to the community and the timeframe provided seems safe and fair. Furthermore, The budget was well explained and detailed to show what will be spent on what. Moreover, the risk mitigation part was quite extensive where the team showcased a great level of seriousness in risk consideration and proposed some alternative routes in case something goes wrong.
f6_assessments.q2: The community can easily track the progress of the project by looking at the content put out and the teams built plus the number of users or mentees. Furthermore, the team provides a detailed roadmap with different milestones and timestamps that would keep them accountable. every milestone will have certain KPIs that have to be met that are clearly stated by the team. Also, the delivery dates are stated as part of the roadmap. I look forward to seeing what will the final project look like.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is for building a "school DAO", and not for providing a new tool, infrastructure or service for DAOs on Cardano, as specified in the challenge brief.

While the proposed platform can be used for PA training for example and by that it could bring some value to the Catalyst community, I find it hard to see how it can be used by other DAOs and how it will leverage the Cardano blockchain to be the go to choice of communities and organization to build their DAOs on.

In conclusion, the proposal does not addressed the challenge and does not align with its goals and KPI.
f6_assessments.q1:
Looking at the links provided by the proposers shows that there was some work been done on this project, and been funded on previews Catalyst funds bring some assurance for the proposers ability to deliver. 

However the proposers did not provide enough information about the team that will work on the project (on the relevant section there is only a name of one member, without experience details or other relevant information) which makes it hard to estimate the proposal success chances.

The plan provided is divided to monthly milestones, but the deliverables described at the plan section are very general and are not clear and detailed enough for an effective estimation.

More details are provided in the "General steps" section that the proposer add, but they do not include clear and measurable deliverable.
f6_assessments.q2:
On the AUDITABILITY section the proposer provided a detailed list of action items, but without an explanation on how the Catalyst community will be able to track the progress and audit the outcomes. 

A measurable and trackable KPIs and success metrics are needed for an affective auditing of the project proposed.

f6_assessments.q0: I love most proposals that focus on the education of blockchain technology. I believe that education in the space is one of the most important parts of the ecosystem right now and should be a bigger focus. There is a clear challenge that there is a lack of education in the world when it comes to this space. The proposal suggests several different ways that they can promote education throughout this industry. My only concern would be gaining a following. There will need to be some additional incentive to make sure that there will be people that participate in the learning experience. For these reasons, I give this section 4 out of 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q1: I struggled to understand what the experience is that will lead this proposal to being implemented successfully. There is a great idea with a challenge. However, there needs be more of a focus on creating a bigger team and following before this proposal would be beneficial to the Cardano community. I think about what would make this proposal feasible. There needs to be a way that we can verify that this proposal will be successful and that there is demand for a proposal as such. Once there is more information and excitement for a proposal like this. I have to give this section 2 out of 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a good amount of information that describes what the school of blockchain will accomplish. But, it is hard to know if there will be enough demand for it. Meaning that people will actually participate and strive to learn more. There are lots of proposals that already have a great following. There isn't enough background information that would suggest that this proposal will be successful. There needs to be a form of accountability. In a decentralized space with a single person requesting funds for a proposal, it is hard for there to be any community engagement. There needs to be a community or maybe a team that can hold each other accountable. I think it is a great idea. But there needs to be more work done before we can ensure that it will be completely beneficial to the ecosystem and that it should receive funding from the Cardano project. For these reasons, I give this section 2 out of 5 stars.

f6_assessments.q0: Education is an important key adoption and formulation of a resilient purpose driven community. However the problem statement described by the proposer is contradicting in some areas. From the beginning, it is described as a project which will explore usecases for DAO and DIDs but while reading through the proposal, i came across where it says "create a functional school or campus environment to benefit learners" which is a bit confusing but information from website depicts the project as an education/learning hub and not a DAO.
f6_assessments.q1: PaoDAO is an ongoing project which has received funding in fund8 and have recorded some key progress so far. The proposer provides me with links to their google docs, website and the video explaining their progress so far.  The team also provides additional milestones to be expected and some realistic timelines (with monthly targets). Some implementation plans mentioned include regrouping and staffing, collab outreach etc. However, i don't see much emphasis in the proposal about providing mainstream Cardano Education (I suppose the learning curve will be biased and focus more on providing Cardano blockchain knowledge), how decentralized the platform will be and what region it will cover first as an experiment. Team should consider to provide a product as an experiment to cover a small area at first and build on the success/failure of the experimented project as some of the approach to execution does not seem to be realizable although the idea is unique. Team should work on providing most needed information in proposal (Most information presented in proposal does not exactly point to an objective solution to the problem statement). Budget is fair and reasonable with a clear breakdown but not much information about the people who will work on the budget items was provided as just one name was provided which does not effectively tally with what is requested in budget.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer provides me with sufficient metrics and KPIs to track the progress of the project. These include roceedings from curating learning resources down to documentation and governance, all of which will be performed in stages for clarity and transparency. Same metrics will used to evaluate success with addition that the open source model will alloemw users to create their own school.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal sets out to further develop the learning platform research approved in fund 8 by moving toward a DAO structure. This will be done by investing methods for rewarding teachers and learners through NFTs and developing a governance structure to manage the project. However, the process for moving in this direction is very unclear. The actual impact measurables are vague at best. There is a lot of language in this area, but the actual output of the project does not seem to be measurable. There is no publicly available community access point at present to investigate whether or not decentralized governance of this project is even feasible. The challenge goal impact statements are not at all clear. There is no specific measurable goal outlined for impact. There is mention of DAO, DID, NFTs, etc in the goal, but there are no specific ways that these will be implemented. The proposal overall feels very general, as though the proposer is not sure exactly what the goal is.
f6_assessments.q1: AS a result of the unspecific goal it is doubtful what will be accomplished with this proposal. Is the goal to study potential incentivization and DAO structures for this educational project? Or is the goal to continue development of an already funded project? Or is the goal to implement a specific governance structure and incentive structure. There should have been ample time to develop a givernencaand incentivization plan during the last funding window, but there is no specific plan laid out here. The team is surely capable of achieving the goal that they have in mind, but it is unclear to the assessor what that goal is. Another generalization is that the entire first month of funding will go to “regrouping and staffing as required.” This implies the proposal is insufficient to assess as there is a good amount of detail yet to be nailed down. Ideally that would have been done prior to submitting this proposal. This proposal plan’s budget is also not detailed enough. There could have been specific funding goals, or milestones. Specific tasks to be accomplished and hourly rates provided. OVerall I do not think with this slack of detail this project is feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: THis proposer has already been working with the catalyst process to achieve results on a previously funded proposal. Therefore, in a positive respect he would be available for auditing purposes, and is aware of the reporting process. The measurables are listed, but due to the project’s overall vagueness how they would work is questionable. If the rest of the proposal were tailored to these measurables, then this could be auditable. But the lack of clarity in the impact and feasibility stage lead to significant questions about what exactly the goal of this project is. Without a clearer goal, the measurables do not make sense. This is why I am uncertain about the auditability of this proposal.

solution: Continue on the first Web 3.0 "school" integrating DAO, DID, contracts, NFT and search functionalities into a scalable, searchable, navigable, sustainable model for supporting learning and community.
experience:
Extensive experience in ed tech, curriculum, adult ed, online facilitation, course development.
Proposer and PA in Fund 8. Presented in ATH and Gimbalabs.
"Cardano Learning Needs Assessment" funded in F8, leading to further development of community-curated curriculum model.
